subject: Let me introduce myself...
msgSnippet: Hello everybody, My name is Benct Philip Jonsson, and I live in Gothenburg, Sweden.  I have a general interest in things linguistic and some semesters of
messageBody:
Hello everybody,

My name is Benct Philip Jonsson, and I live in Gothenburg,
Sweden. I have a general interest in things linguistic and some
semesters of training in Scandinavian and Indo-European
philology. There is a special place in my heart for writing
systems, and thence for transliteration, spelling reform and the
development of writing systems for hitherto unwritten languages.
I'm also a shorthand user since almost twenty years (Melin's
Swedish system, which I have adapted myself to English and
Icelandic). I have known of Shavian for almost as long as I've
been interested in Shorthand, but learnt of Quikscript only
recently (at omniglot.com).

I have two questions:

What is the logic behind the Quiqscript font layout?

Do speakers of American accents with merger between the vowels
of father-cot-caught spell accordingly? And if so, which letter
do they use?

--

/BP 8^)>
--
Benct Philip Jonsson -- melroch at melroch dot se

Solitudinem faciunt pacem appellant!
(Tacitus)

Hello everybody,

My name is Benct Philip Jonsson, and I live in Gothenburg,
Sweden.  I have a general interest in things linguistic and some
semesters of training in Scandinavian and Indo-European
philology.  There is a special place in my heart for writing
systems, and thence for transliteration, spelling reform and the
development of writing systems for hitherto unwritten languages.
I'm also a shorthand user since almost twenty years (Melin's
Swedish system, which I have adapted myself to English and
Icelandic).  I have known of Shavian for almost as long as I've
been interested in Shorthand, but learnt of Quikscript only
recently (at omniglot.com).

I have two questions:

What is the logic behind the Quiqscript font layout?

Do speakers of American accents with merger between the vowels
of father-cot-caught spell accordingly?  And if so, which letter
do they use?

-- 

/BP 8^)>
--
Benct Philip Jonsson -- melroch at melroch dot se

         Solitudinem faciunt pacem appellant!
                                             (Tacitus)
